revised_title: A Condensed Approach to Heppel's Theory of Continuous Beams
tldr: This article presents a condensed version of Mr. Heppel's theory of continuous beams, making it easier for engineers and students to understand and apply the principles. The author, W.J.M. Rankine, explains the mathematical problem of stress in continuous beams and provides a linear relation between bending moments at three consecutive points of support. This theory can be used in practice and for scientific study of beam structures.
